text:
MICHAEL Sheen and Sarah Silverman joked they’d “consciously uncoupled” as they announced their split.
US comedian Sarah borrowed the phrase Gwyneth Paltrow and Chris Martin used to describe their split, as she told fans on Twitter about the break-up.
Splash News Michael Sheen and Sarah Silverman have broken up after four years
Sarah, 47, said: “The great Michael Sheen and I consciously uncoupled over Christmas.
“I mean, not 'over Christmas' - like that wasn't the fight that ended it. No fight.
“We just live in different countries & it got hard.
“Felt we should just tell y'all so u stop asking, 'How's Michael/How's Sarah?’”
Twitter Comedienne Sarah announced the news on Twitter
Splash News She said the pair didn't like the long distance and insisted their had been no 'big fight'
Sarah started dating British actor Michael, 49, following his split with Kate Beckinsale.
The women became good pals and last year Michael and Kate reunited to support their daughter Lily as she graduated.
Michael recently revealed he was quitting Hollywood to go back to Wales to fight the far right movement.
Getty - Contributor Michael revealed he was quitting Hollywood to move back to Wales to fight the far right
Sheen, who has played Tony Blair in a trio of films, told The Times Magazine: “In the same way as the Nazis had to be stopped in Germany in the Thirties, this thing that is on the rise has to be stopped.”
The actor claimed he could bring people together “who wouldn’t normally sit there…even if they just want me to sign their Twilight books for their kids”.

He said he was expecting a backlash against the decision, saying: “It will be a big change for how people relate to me. Once I’m in, I’m fully in, and this is big.
“As soon as you start to be effective, then people try to crush you, because it’s dangerous.”
Last year he gave a speech in Wales in defence of free healthcare, telling the crowd: “There is never an excuse to not speak up for what you think is right.”
